Name: Bust of Montuemhat
Description: This head belongs to Montuemhat, the Fourth Prophet of Amun, Mayor of Thebes and Governor of Upper Egypt. He was the greatest man in Upper Egypt during the Twenty-Fifth Dynasty and at the beginning of the Twenty-Sixth Dynasty. The head depicts him as an old man who is bald. He has narrow eyes, well-defined cheekbones, and a wrinkled face. The statue reflects his intelligence and strong personality.
